data.title: Creature fighting
data.solution:
Module Solution
    Function ReadCreature() As (Strength As Integer, Endurance As Integer,
        Firststrike As Boolean, Deathtouch as Boolean)
        Dim creature = Console.ReadLine.Split
        Dim se = creature(0).Split("/")
        Return (se(0), se(1), creature.Contains("Firststrike"),
            creature.Contains("Deathtouch"))
    End Function

    Function WhoWins() As Integer
        Dim c1 = ReadCreature
        Dim c2 = ReadCreature
        Dim k1 = (c1.Deathtouch And c1.Strength > 0) Or c1.Strength >= c2.Endurance
        Dim k2 = (c2.Deathtouch And c2.Strength > 0) Or c2.Strength >= c1.Endurance
        If k1 And c1.Firststrike And Not c2.FirstStrike Then Return 1
        If k2 And c2.Firststrike And Not c1.FirstStrike Then Return 2
        If k1 And k2 Then Return 0
        If k1 Then Return 1
        If k2 Then Return 2
        Return 3
    End Function

    Sub Main
        Console.Write(WhoWins)
    End Sub
End Module
data.statement:
Two creatures are fighting. Their [[strength]] and [[endurance]] is represented by an integer. The strength corresponds to the damage they do and the endurance to how much damage is needed to kill them. So a creature with strength 4 in a regular fight will kill a creature with endurance 4 or less.

However, creatures can have any number of those attributes:
{{Firststrike}}: the creature deals damage before the other one (unless the other creature also has {{Firststrike}}). Otherwise damage is dealt simultaneously.
{{Deathtouch}}: if the creature deals any damage to the other creature, the latter will die.

Determine which creatures will be alive at the end of combat.

Note :
- There is <<only one round>>. After that, creatures will rest.
- A creature with {{0}} strength still goes to combat but doesn't deal any damage.
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: [[strength1]]/[[endurance1]] [[attributes1]] of the first creature
<<Line 2>>: [[strength2]]/[[endurance2]] [[attributes2]] of the second creature

Attributes are separated by spaces.

Example: <<2/1 Firststrike Deathtouch>>
is a creature with strength 2, endurance 1, Firststrike and Deathtouch attributes.
data.outputDescription: {{0}} if no creature survives, {{1}} if only the first creature survives, {{2}} if only the second one survives, {{3}} if both survive

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Two creatures are fighting. Their strength and endurance is represented by an integer. The strength corresponds to the damage they do and the endurance to how much damage is needed to kill them. So a creature with strength 4 in a regular fight will kill a creature with endurance 4 or less.

However, creatures can have any number of those attributes:
Firststrike: the creature deals damage before the other one (unless the other creature also has Firststrike). Otherwise damage is dealt simultaneously.
Deathtouch: if the creature deals any damage to the other creature, the latter will die.

Determine which creatures will be alive at the end of combat.

Note :
- There is only one round. After that, creatures will rest.
- A creature with 0 strength still goes to combat but doesn't deal any damage.
Input
Line 1: strength1/endurance1 attributes1 of the first creature
Line 2: strength2/endurance2 attributes2 of the second creature

Attributes are separated by spaces.

Example: 2/1 Firststrike Deathtouch
is a creature with strength 2, endurance 1, Firststrike and Deathtouch attributes.
Output
0 if no creature survives, 1 if only the first creature survives, 2 if only the second one survives, 3 if both survive
Constraints
0 ≤ strength,endurance ≤ 20
Example
Input
4/5
2/1
Output
1
